review: Luvox (fluvoxamine):Makes my OCD manageable. Has given me headaches and/or insomnia when I start taking it for the first time in a long time, but they usually go away. And it sure beats staying up because I’m too anxious to fall asleep. (Have been taking it on and off for about 4 years) Just remember everyone’s bodies respond to different drugs differently.

OCD/PTSD/DEPRESSION I've tried a few different types of medication and this one actually works for me, 300mg at night 2 years now I don't really get stuck on intrusive thoughts like I used too, I still get sad sometimes but it's still a normal emotion, I've been able to learn the difference from a depressive sadness to a normal sadness if that makes sense haha.-Personal Side effects,I sweat a heap more in any physical activity.Sex drive is ehh.Insomnia.-Please save yourself and do not abruptly stop unless you want to be incredibly irritable, brain zaps nearly all the time, headaches, no sleep... The list goes on.

This has been a life changer for me in the best way possible. I was driven by anxiety and compulsive thoughts. I had some compulsive rituals, but my obsessive thoughts controlled me completely and would send me into a downward spiral of anxiety and depression. I had to learn how to live again as a normal human being when the medication started kicking in. I am so laid back now and don’t worry about much. I finally feel free from the weight of my OCD/anxiety/depression.

Ive been taking it for 2 weeks now and its not helpful, I got some side effects like insane memory problems and nausea from time to time. It still hasn't stopped me from washing my hands 8 times or even my impulsive thoughts.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):Was giving this to my daughter of 17 yrs of age She struggles with anxiety and intrusive thoughts / ocdShe was on clomipramine 50 mg for 8 months and had a great normal life but after 8 months the horrible side effects returned  with heart palpitations and bad bad stomachache We switched her to Luvox 1/2 tablet to start cause she is sensitive to meds and by the 2nd night of a whole tablet dosage she had extreme rage and sadness This wasn’t any help for her it actually made thing way worse and woke up her inner demons ! She now moved to lexapro fingers crossed God bless those in search of peace
Perfect for OCD . This SSRI is stronger than others and it also have a sedative properties . Life changed after this.

I’ve had OCD since I was very little — about 7 years old. I was misdiagnosed with ADHD when I was actually extremely stressed from my unstable home life and I was given Vyvanse. The drug made my life a living nightmare and that’s when my OCD started. Since then I’ve been on and off with the disorder. I finally was prescribed Fluvoxamine and noticed multiple aspects of my life change. I no longer had migraines, my emotions felt more relaxed and slow, and my intrusive thoughts didn’t come with the same kick of anxiety that they normally had. I am on 100 mg right now but I plan to go up to 200. So far I would say this medicine is working great!

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I was on Luvox for OCD, MDD, anxiety, and dermatillomania. Zoloft didn't work, so I tried Luvox. At first I felt a slight uplift in my mood, but then I started crying every day and became anorexic. I lost weight to the point where I began to look sickly. I've never had any eating disorder prior to my experience on Luvox. It felt like I relapsed and got worse symptoms from my OCD. I'm sure this drug helps others, but it just wasn't the right one for me.

It wasn’t bad at all. I would say it kinda saved me. My OCD was so bad it was interfering with every day. I have pure O OCD. Though I do think that some of it was me becoming better at managing it; the fluvoxamine made me fairly normal again. My OCD would still happen and my root causes didn’t go away, but it did make me better probably 50%. Only issue for me was when I tried to raise dose which was probably the reason I still had some OCD, my side effects were wayyyy too much. Give it a try though it’s definitely worth trying. I’m happy I did it and it was a small success.

Luvox has been a great drug for me!  I have been in it for over 20 years.  I had big problems with OCD, & now I’m doing great.  The repetitive thoughts that would go through my head are gone & the compulsion to do repetitive praying is also gone or at least GREATLY diminished.  OCD sufferers, take heart!

I was on prozac that caused a horrible experience that I had to suffer for months, and it continued even after I stopped it.  It only got better when I took Fluvoxamine. I don’t usually write reviews but this saved me after I got out of the the hospital. I could actually think through my thoughts and I felt it right away but it wasn’t officially at it best until it was totally in my system for a month or two, but just in a week I did feel like a whole new person was able to go a day with a severe panic attack for the first time in a while. I read the reviews when I first started taking it and I was very nervous but everyone is different, so give it and chance and move on if doesn’t work. 10/10

This was the most horrid, awful medication I’ve ever taken. I had it prescribed after I had a psychotic episode on Prozac. I was depressed, panicked constantly, and very moody. Doctor originally had me on 25mg then bumped to 50mg. Both awful. Do not recommend fluvoxamine at all

I suffer from OCD and Bipolar Disorder. I started off taking Anafranil when I was 18 years old. I ended up in professional school and was having a hard time remembering material. Also very depressed and anxious. My doctor switched me to Luvox when I was 24 years old ( between semesters). It was hard getting on to it, nausea and constipation. Plus, I couldn't sleep as well. Otherwise though, it made my depression almost disappear and I burned through my academic material so much faster and more efficient than on Anafranil. For me, a huge improvement over Anafranil. Much has happened since I started Luvox, such as a manic attack and diagnosis with BPD, divorce after 12 weeks  etc.. I will never have the normal life I would have if I had no mental illness. But I am still on Luvox after 24 yrs. Fluvoxamine/Luvox has made my life a lot easier and closer to normal.
This medication made me crippling depressed to the point where I would have frequent suicidal thoughts .

My wife has taken fluvoxamine for 20 years now. A life saver. But since the company stopped making 50mg dose she has had to use a different brand. I can see a difference and while not drastic, the downturn is disheartening.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I take Anafranil for 32 years now, after a diagnosis of OCD when I was 15 years old; doctor said I would have to take it for the rest of my life. Two years ago, I asked the psychiatrist to try to switch the medicine, because of side effects I have that really disturb me (great hair loss, permanent dry mouth, lack of libido, etc.). Eventually, she prescribed fluvoxamine, so I stopped Anafranil and started it. The experience was AWFUL: immediately I started feeling kind of detached from everything, what it came out to be as a profound state of depression. The doctor increased the dose and things didn't change at all. After two and a half months taking fluvoxamine and feeling completely depressed, emotional detached from everything and with a permanent underlying "dark"/strange feeling, I decided to stop it. Instead, that night I took half of my usual 75 mg Anafranil; the next morning I was just fine, the "normal", functional me.

I have been on it a month and I feel like it is possibly going to change my life!  I didn't think it would work but I can feel thoughts pop into my mind and sometimes let them go.  I am still compulsive, but less so.  I feel happier and not panicky and worried almost all of the time.  It is sedating and I think I feel less motivated, though, but I am not sure if it because I am less high on nerves driving me on all the time and now depression is bringing me down or if it is the drug.
Luvox took a few weeks to work, but boy has it worked. Anafranil worked better for OCD but my insurance won’t cover it anymore. Anafranil was a little 10 rating but Luvox is a pretty good substitute.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I took luvox for one day. My OCD had been getting better because of ERP and I knew my OCD theme was just OCD. However, when I took luvox I literally felt like my OCD came to life & it was worse than ever. It dramatically worsened my OCD, I literally felt psychotic & I could barely sleep that night.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I've been on Luvox for around five to six months. I'm taking 150mg and it is NOT working at all. Intrusive thoughts and OCD are worse than ever. I really am considering taking myself off this horrible medication.

This medication helped me a lot. I had to start on a very low dose (10 MG) because my body is extremely sensitive to SSRI medication. After I got used to it, we increased to 20 MG and now on 20 MG and have seen gradual improvement in my repetitive thoughts and actions. It has helped my mood a lot too even when things seem to get very stressful.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I have been on Luvox for 4 years now and it has medicine worked for me very well for OCD. I almost have no anxiety anymore. The downsides are that I have had loss of libido, constipated all the time and insomnia. I haven’t had any problems with weight gain like other antidepressants.

I’ve been taking Luvox for almost 2 months now. I’ve realized that I worry less considering my OCD tendencies where all I do is think of the worst possible outcome. It at least steers me away from that. But I do feel extremely fatigue in the morning where I have to drag through life until the half life of so comes up so it will be less of an impact. I just moved up to 75mg and I think I want to go back down to 50mg because I am extremely tired and almost fell asleep at work even after seven hours of sleep. Over all it is not bad but not the best. I’ve taken many SSRI, SNRI, psychotics for bipolar 2, OCD, anxiety, and depression so it gets frustrating when you feel like you can’t find the perfect match.

Fluvoxamine has been beneficial for the OCD obsessing and horrible anxiety I had been feeling.  The issues with it are bad heartburn and tiredness/sleepiness throughout the day.  I have been on it for about a month and a half.  I have added an anti-heartburn OTC medication to combat the heartburn.  I am going to give this a try and if I cannot tolerate the side effects within the next 3-6 months, I will try something else.  I also tried the extended release version at the same dosage.  This didn't help the OCD as well and I was left with some anxiety.  The heartburn was a bit better but nothing to celebrate about.  The tiredness/sleepiness remained as well.

This medication fluvoxamine is a godsend for OCD, my obsessive thoughts reduced by 90-95%. I've been on it for a little over three years, and it only gets better with time. My ONLY issue with this is I find myself losing a lot more hair than usual... I never really noticed it until a year or so ago, but I strongly suspect it's the Luvox. All other blood work is normal (vitamin levels too). I know there have been a couple of articles on SSRI hair loss, esp. with Luvox, so I thought I'd put it out there. And there is slight drowsiness, which is totally fine for me because it chilled me out (I'm a high energy, anxious person), but if you struggle with depression this might be something to consider, as it is sedating. For me, it's been great, and I wish I had this stuff back in high school!

Luvox (fluvoxamine):Considering quitting Luvox / Fluvoxamine.I’ve been on Luvox for 9 weeks on 100mg. Increased dose to 200mg since 10 days ago and considering giving up on the medication as I feel it’s not helping me. I’m not sure what to do, whether I should stick to the increased dose or just give it up right now.

After the first night on fluvoxamine I woke up the next day with cotton mouth. The next day I was urinating every thirty minutes without anything that would quench my thirst. The third day I felt like I was getting physically sick. The fourth pill  night, I had insomnia and was up about four hours after my usual bedtime. My mind was racing and I was exhausted all the way through half the next day. When I did fall asleep I woke up twice with incredible paranoia. I felt like I was on some kind of stimulant, and an odd feeling I’ve never felt mentally. Totally did NOT like it. Stopped taking it after the fourth pill. I’m BP 2, GAD, panic disorder, OCD.

I took fluvoxamine 200 mg daily for 6 years for OCD/generalized anxiety disorder, but now that I've weaned off I don't think it helped at all with that, or only a little. However, it gave me non-24 sleep disorder. This is apparently a very rare sleep disorder that only blind people usually get, but I'm not blind. With this sleep disorder I was going to bed 1 hour later every day, so that I might be going to bed at 11 PM today, but 12 days later I'm going to bed at 11 AM. I would go "around the clock" within a month.It was terrible. That lasted for the entire 6 years I was on fluvoxamine, but I had no idea what caused it. I thought I had a neurological problem, or my circadian rhythm was messed up. Maybe I needed melatonin or light therapy or expensive sleep therapists. Nope. As soon as I weaned off the Luvox a few months ago, my sleep schedule went back to almost normal, the way it was before Luvox. Apparently this is a very rare side effect on this drug...or maybe not?

I felt like fluvoxamine made me emotional and kind of angry. It was not good for me and I had to stop taking it after a short time. Only other medication that did this was Cymbalta. Im not sure of the connection but I have been on what seems like EVERYTHING at one time or another over 50 years.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):Medical Student experiencing OCD since 9 years old. Luvox is Lifechanging for OCD. Begin with this for OCD. Should it not work, don't despair, everyone is different. You will find your solution eventually. For OCD Luvox is the place to start. Lifechanging. OCD dropped from 13 hours a day to 5 minutes. Lifechanging.

I have OCD, depression, anxiety and I switched to Luvox in early April 2020 and recently tapered off and started Trintellix. I’ve also been on Lexapro, Prozac, Pristiq, and Trazadone. Anyways, Luvox made every aspect of my mental health worse. I was crying all the time, very irritable, crazy mood swings, and my anxiety was worse and worse as I went up on my dosage. I stuck it out for a while because I know medications can make you worse before better but I was miserable. All of these symptoms got worse when I had to taper off 200mg to 50mg and then stop. I’ve been on 5 antidepressants and Luvox, was by far my worst experience. Truly made me worse. I was told it was the gold standard for dermatillamania  (skin picking disorder) by my doctor and saw no improvement in that. This drug is not for me. I’ve been on Trintellix for just over 3 weeks and wow... I’m feeling so much better.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):My daughter has been on Luvox for 2 years. She started it when she was 11 years old due to extreme OCD symptoms. We didn't see a difference for about 6 to 8 weeks. She is currently on 150mg. This completely stopped all of her horrible intrusive thoughts however she was still dealing with other OCD traits for example not letting anyone touch or pat our dog for fear of germs, this would cause severe aggitation and anger disregulation so she started to take Abilify 5mg in the morning. This hit the spot perfectly and her OCD started to fade away and of course no aggitation or anger bursts. We have just started to reduce the Luvox to try and get down to 100mg and so far no problems but it is still early days. We did take her off the Abilfy for 4 months but the aggitation and OCD symptoms showed up slowly and we decided to out her back on it. We are hoping to try again soon as being more mature she can use her skills she has learned through CBT to manage her thoughts.

Just started with Uvox 50mg for my OCD. My doctor has started with 50 mg for 4 days and then 100 mg for next 14 days to see the results. I was on Pexep CR 25 for six months but noticed that 25 mg cause loose motions and 12.5 mg was not not working at all. Let's see how Uvox will work. I'm so fed up with my OCD as I keep repeating same things all day. A little change in health and I desperately start searching google.

I started on 50 mg of fluvoxamine then jumped to 150 mg ER. I could not sleep. The anxiety was awful. I went on spending binges and had to return most of it because I ordered multiples of the same item. I am down to 25 mg in the morning and will come off this drug. When I first started this drug I had diarrhea for the first month. Didn’t work for me but hopefully will work for you.

I’ve been on Luvox  (150 mg) for 2 months due to OCD and anxiety and it has been great! My obsession with negative thought went away and I don’t ever remember I had them! I don’t have any more anxiety in my chest, is incredible! It also helped me with my appetite and mood. The only down side is that for the first month I was really really tired and slept almost all day. But the drowsiness  went away after the second month.
fluvoxamine has been an excellent medication for OCD!  Takes a while to work. You need to be patient! The results are amazing!

Luvox (fluvoxamine):29YO FE with Harm OCD. I started taking Celexa when I was 16 years old for around 6 years & then switched to Lexapro. Celexa and Lexapro both worked for me with Lexapro being the champion of the two. Eventually the Lexapro did not work anymore. I experienced panic attacks, aggressive violent thoughts & high anxiety. I recently switched to Luvox but not without initial hesitation. I tried many different medications that led up to Lexapro with many that didn't work. I am glad that I gave Luvox a try! It was slow weaning down from 20mg of Lexapro while increasing up to 100mg Luvox. Now the obsessive and compulsive thoughts are more fleeting and less sticky, they do not bother me as much anymore. I do not have the anxiety that I once had. One drawback that I experience after taking Luvox for a couple months is...TIREDNESS. Very tired throughout the day, sleep more than usual and take plenty of naps. Overall this medication works for me and I hope that it will for you too.

I took fluvoxamine medicine for OCD. Im a rapid absorber of medicine. I found that this medicine did slightly help with OCD but the side effects were pretty rough. I had overwhelming anxiety, sweating like crazy, and it caused me to start mood cycling. One day I would be in almost euphoria the next so down I couldn't even continue at work. And like clock work the next day I would cycle. Also the half life is 13 hours so if you take it at night it wears off by 4pm and you start withdrawing, big no for me.

I have suffered from severe OCD for many years been put on many medications that did not work Luvox-Fluvoxamine generic version of Luvox is what I found worked wonder for my OCD. It takes time you need to give it time I started with a small dose for a couple of months then used then the dose was doubled couple months later and this continued until my dose was at 300MG 150 morning and 150 at night and my OCD is barely noticeable any longer. After trying many different medications this is the only one that helped with my OCD. It took me a while for this to work and with every increase in dosage, my OCD was better until I reached 300 MG and now I feel great and am in control of my life once again.

Prescribed fluvoxamine in mental hospital for OCD with Abilify. It was very difficult to tolerate. Had lots of panic attacks especially before sleep. Still have to take Valium and Ambien to help me sleep and function during the day. Depression is improved, but still waiting on the OCD part. Too early to tell, therefore, I will write another review in 8 weeks. Other symptoms include nausea, palpitations, tiredness, and anxiety.

I have to credit this medication with saving my life. Over the past 13 years, I’ve been on over 30 different medications. Every SSRI, SNRI, ketamine, even the antipsychotics. When those failed, I had ECT. My OCD was so severe that I was hospitalized twice for suicidal ideation. I was unable to work, unable to finish my degree because I couldn’t stop obsessing. I was miserable. Now I’ve been on Luvox for 2 years. I’ve gotten married. I have a job and a house. Things that I never thought it would be able to have. Yes, life is still a daily challenge, but it’s not unbearable. Luvox is the only drug that has calmed my OCD. 150mg. The only side effects are nausea and complete loss of libido. Small prices to pay sanity.

While outwardly successful and happy, for 30 years I'd only known life as focussing on my deficiencies and wanton risk taking with a white hot rage against myself.On starting fluvoxamine, I had 1 week of nausea - and then the climb to awesomeness began... I can't imagine life without them now!I have *complete* control over my thoughts.  I've always loathed the control my emotions had over me - I can now turn them on and off at will.  On, when I should be compassionate or loving, off at all other times.  I keep my head - always.  Awkward social encounters make me think: "curious..." for a moment, then I can choose to discount the thought and move on.  Despite the usual marital stresses of money, sex etc:  I can shrug and accept events as they unfold. I can choose to discuss points with *zero* emotive content.I use my ability to regulate my emotions as the guide to  my dose. I started at 100mg, spent 6 months at 200mg, and I've been at 150 for the past 2 years.

Before taking this fluvoxamine, I would pick at my face until I looked horrifying. I was 14. People used to ask me if I had measles. Whatever I tried, I couldn’t stop. It was an embarrassment to go to school, and taking Luvox was a last resort. I really didn’t have much choice. Luvox improves my life immensely and my life goes badly when I go off it. I’m now 26. I’m very stable at the moment. But I’ve never had an orgasm. I thinking about trying to go off it after all these years. It’s frustrating because it helps me so much, I need it, but I want to enjoy sex.
The worst poison you could possibly take. It stops you sleeping at night leaves you tired during the day does nothing for intrusive thoughts

I was on this medication for about a year and it helped a little with OCD repetitive disturbing thoughts and a little with anxiety. However it gave me a lot of fatigue, making driving and working a challenge, as well as severe constipation. That is why I had to stop taking it. Coming off of it was extremely difficult as I got strong zaps, tremors and dizziness for 2 months straight that interfered with my job and just about everything else. I wish I could have stayed on it without the symptoms.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):Luvox changed my life. It took away the guilt I have felt my entire life. Remember, it is important to go to therapy prior to starting a medications. I specifically went to exposure and response prevention therapy for 8 months prior to starting this drug. This medication is a miracle for those experiencing severe OCD and more specifically, instructive thoughts. What thus drug does is lessen the amount of intrusive thoughts you have and allows you to have a normal reaction to the thoughts. Please note that it does not take the thoughts away completely, it is not meant to. This drug also worked very quickly. I personally find it important to gradually increase the dose every few weeks to a month. I have had no side effects, except for some difficult falling asleep. I am so grateful I found this, highly recommend!

Well, after 5 years struggling with severe OCD (31 points on Y-BOCS) and 5 different drugs (2 SSRI's, 1 TCA's, 1 antipsychotic and 1 benzodiazepine) with plenty of side effects and not a satisfactory response I gave fluvoxamine a go. Long story short, had a 75% decrease on my Y-BOCS score, meaning "very much improved" (I went from 31 points which means severe OCD to 8 points which means mild OCD). With bibliotherapy (aka reading plenty of Acceptance and Commitment Therapy and Metacognitive Therapy Books) I've achieved complete freedom from OCD, being clinically healthy. Only downside is that fluvoxamine gave me extreme drowsiness which I counter with 150mg/day of modafinil (that's why I gave 9/10).

Luvox (fluvoxamine):Hello, My son takes luvox in a small dose to lessen OCD but if we increase his dose it makes his OCD WORSE...I do want to share that he had a sudden onset of OCD OVERNIGHT!  Turns out it is from LYME DISEASE and Bartonella co-infection which causes PANS - Postimmune Neurological Syndrome!  Strep, Lyme and other bacteria can cause this...If OCD medicine doesn't really work, check with your doctor and ask about PANS LYME or PANDAS from Strep...

This drug  fluvoxamine has drastically improved my OCD symptoms, but there have been side effects that I'm getting sick of after almost three years.  It has really messed up my sleep.  Ever since I had begun taking it I either sleep way, way too much, or I can't sleep at all.  Some days I can't think of anything except taking a nap, despite having slept an adequate amount of time the previous night.  It really helped me be bold, and I don't get nervous about things the way I used to.  It's getting to the point, however, where I don't care about anything.  The OCD symptoms are gone, but I'm learning what depression feels like.  It gave me memory problems as well.  Overall this medication has been wonderful and I don't feel OCD symptoms very often.  When I do, they are easy to dismiss.  I'm ready for a break from the side effects though, so I'm gonna go off soon.

At its core I am being prescribed this for OCD, ruminations, and my eating disorder (restrictive eating and bulimia). I have been on this medication for almost two months along with Ritalin. I feel like this medication has tremendously helped... I would hate to admit that. No side effects to report. I still get amazing work outs in, I want to work out everyday... no hair loss or weight gain. All reasons why I was terrified to start meds in the first place. I lost weight, I don’t ruminate about my past relationship or food. I am following a meal plan. I feel great. I recommend this medication. I hope my dose gets increased or they can add one more medication to help reduce some of the anxiousness I have about the future. Otherwise I say give this a shot if you have given other meds a try and they haven’t worked I take 25mg in morning, 50 at night.
I finally reached mental clarity

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I’ve been taking Luvox for close to 15 years. I started on 50mg and moved to 100mg after about 3 years. I am now on 200mg (recently increased from 150mg). I take 100mg in the AM and 100mg before bed. It’s stopped me from experiencing distressing intrusive thoughts completely and helped reduce my anxiety to a manageable level. I also take seroquel and concerta on work days.
Luvox (fluvoxamine):Luvox worked for about 6 months and I started going downhill again.  My symptoms seem to be getting worse.  Not all out horrible but definitely obstructing my normal activity.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I have now been on 65-75 mg of Luvox for about 3 years for Obsessive Thoughts Disorder, which I had suffered from intensely since childhood. I was put on everything under the sun, mostly being treated with less specific, but more well known medicines (mostly focusing on depression, anxiety - though it was always known to be OCD). This drug has changed my life. I have went gone constant ruminating, to absolutely no worrying signs of OCD. I at first felt severe side effects of fatigue, tingly body, anxiety and needing total silence. It was a weird 2 weeks. But as soon as that passed, it has been the miracle I prayed for. I hope it can do the same for you.

fluvoxamine did help a lot with my ocd, HOWEVER, it increased my depression. I ended up getting hospitalized because of how severe my depression was getting. This medication made me feel numb. So I guess yes, I was not anxious anymore, but I couldn’t feel anything. I guess this medication may be worth a try, but if you already suffer with depression/ suicidal thoughts this medication may make it worse, like it did with me. In conclusion, this medication did really help with my OCD, but I had to get off of it because of how severe it made my depression. Just be aware of the symptoms of depression and be closely monitored if you decide to take this medication. If it wasn’t for how bad it made my depression, Luvox would have been my miracle drug for treating my ocd

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I have obsessive compulsive disorder and social anxiety and I have taken Luvox for two years. I have been on 100 mg for a year and I think that the pills do work for anxiety and OCD and my social anxiety is almost gone. The problem is that Luvox makes me gain a little bit of weight and it’s really hard to lose weight.  I have reduced my calorie intake and I’m going to the gym but still I can’t lose any weight and I have tried now for two months. Luvox is really stopping me from losing weight. My depression hasn’t got any better it’s still the same.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):I’ve been on Luvox for about a year and a half now, far better than Zoloft for me. Zoloft just made me feel like a zombie with anxiety and depression. Luvox has allowed me to totally stop my ruminating thoughts completely. My depression is still very real though, it feels like there is a weight on my brain. I’ve tried to augment with a few medications so far with none helping. Might switch to something different soon, but 10/10 for OCD,  2/10 for depression
fluvoxamine is excellent for my ocd. I take 250 mg and my ocd has improved significantly! But wait a while for the best results. Maybe 01 month or more...I totally recommend this medicine.

Luvox CR (fluvoxamine):I’ve been on antidepressants for years. Prozac helped me but then stopped being effective. So I got prescribed Luvax. The biggest problem was the side effects. I had the most painful stomach cramps and diarrhea along with horrible anxiety and palpitations. These made me give up on sticking with it. I’m not sure if it would work well if I stuck with it but the side effects were too severe for me.

I have been on nearly every SSRI there is, over a period of nearly 2 years. I suffer from severe depression coupled with anxiety and OCD. My doctor wanted me to try Luvox  and it took almost 8 weeks for me to finally feel better! I started at 50 mg , then went up to 100 mg. When she had me go up to 150 mg. I was unable to tolerate it, because of the terrible side effects (waking up with severe chest pain, severe anxiety, burning lips and mouth, no appetite ) so I backed down to 100mg again. Then she had me try 150 again. This time was the dose was great. I woke up one morning and for a the first time, I had no chest pain. I felt actually like my normal self. I was able to eat, I was laughing, and I cleaned my house ( and boy was it dusty). Just an FYI, I am also taking 200 of Lamictical , and 200 mg of Seroquel- I sleep very well! Just want to share my success. Depression definitely stinks! I had to quit my job  as an elementary school teacher, and I went on disability.

Luvox (fluvoxamine):Loved this drug  Luvox for my OCD. Bathed my brain in Serotonin. And while that was a good solution, it was also posed a problem. It took anxiety/OCD away better then most SSRI's I have tried. However, it made my me incredibly tried. You could literally sleep for 22 hours out of the day if you could afford to do so. But, my experience will not be yours, so don't rule it out as a possible treatment for your OCD.

Don't touch this stuff.  I was taking fluvoxamine for about 3 years with side effects like excessive sweating, sedation, memory impairment.  After stopping the drug I became irritable, stress intolerant depressed anxious, poor attention and memory problems.  These SSRI's don't rebalance the brain they just make you numb like a zombie
